params.claimant: The address attempting to claim the tag (not necessarily the address that will receive it)
params.guildHash: The ENS namehash of the guild's domain
params.recipient: The address that would receive the tag
params.tag: The tag being claimed (e.g. 'foo' for foo.my-guild.eth)

onTagClaimed(bytes32,string,address,addr.details: protects against reentrancy and checks that caller is the Guilds contract. Updating any state is deferred to the implementation.

params.claimant: The address that claimed the tag (not necessarily the address that received it)
params.guildHash: The ENS namehash of the guild's domain
params.recipient: The address that received receive the tag
params.tag: The tag being claimed (e.g. 'foo' for foo.my-guild.eth)

returns.tagToRevoke: The ENS namehash of any tag that should be revoked as a consequence of the given tag being claimed. Returns zero if no tag should be revoked.

params.extraRevokeArgs: Any additional arguments necessary for assessing whether a tag may be revoked
params.guildHash: The ENS namehash of the guild's domain
params.revokedBy: The address that would attempt to revoke it
params.tag: The tag being revoked (e.g. 'foo' for foo.my-guild.eth)

canClaimTag(bytes32,string,address,addre.notice: Checks whether a certain address (claimant) may claim a given guild tag

tagCanBeRevoked(address,bytes32,string,b.notice: Checks whether a given guild tag is eligible to be revoked

userdoc.notice: A common implementation of TagsAuthPolicy that can be used to restrict minting guild tags to only allowlisted addresses. A separate allowlist is maintained per each guild, and may only be updated by that guild's registered admin.
